meanings.definition: Resembling a cow in appearance or behavior.
meanings.sent1: The large, cowish dog lazily grazed in the field.
meanings.sent2: The cowish markings on the horse made it stand out in the pasture.
meanings.sent3: The cowish cat tried to moo like a cow, much to the amusement of the children.
meanings.sent4: Her cowish laughter echoed through the room, deep and hearty.
meanings.sent5: The cowish clouds slowly drifted across the sky, resembling a herd of cows.

meanings.definition: Showing characteristics typically associated with cows.
meanings.sent1: The farmer wore a cowish hat with cow print all over it.
meanings.sent2: The cowish smell of the barn reminded him of his childhood on the farm.
meanings.sent3: The cowish behavior of the students lining up single file made the teacher smile.
meanings.sent4: Her cowish stubbornness was evident when she refused to budge from her decision.
meanings.sent5: The cowish expression on his face as he chewed his food made him look comical.
